thread.title: Dodgers claim pitcher Brooks Brown from Colorado
thread.title_full: Dodgers claim pitcher Brooks Brown from Colorado

author: wtopstaff
title: Dodgers claim pitcher Brooks Brown from Colorado
text:
Home » News » Sports » MLB » Dodgers claim pitcher Brooks… Dodgers claim pitcher Brooks Brown from Colorado By The Associated Press October 14, 2015 7:28 pm 
LOS ANGELES (AP) — The Dodgers have claimed pitcher Brooks Brown from the Colorado Rockies, joining Zack Greinke as the second right-hander on their playoff roster. 
Brown was 1-4 with a 3.97 ERA in 64 career relief appearances for the Rockies over 2014 and this year. The 30-year-old pitcher was limited to 36 games this season because of right shoulder inflammation. As a rookie, he had a 2.77 ERA in 28 games last year. 
The Dodgers on Wednesday designated right-hander Jim Johnson for assignment. He was 0-3 with one save and a 10.13 ERA in 23 games after being acquired from Atlanta in a July 30 trade. Johnson had been left off the playoff roster. Topics:
